description: Numbers n such that 6n+5 is composite.
comments: Conjecture : There exists no pair of primes (p,q>p^2) such that q-p^2 = 6*n-4 (see A138479) - Philippe LALLOUET (philip.lallouet(AT)orange.fr), Mar 20 2008Let p=prime number, n=(p^2+2p-5)/6 mod (p); ex: 10=(5^2+10-5)/6 mod (5); 34 = (11^2+22-5)/6 mod (11); or n=(p^2+4p-5)/6 mod (p); ex: 19=(7^2+28-5)/6 mod (7). [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 07 2010]
author: _Anton Joha_, Jan 26 2001
